required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Robot Gait Training With Brain Stimulation on Gait Function in Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Robot Gait Training With Brain Stimulation on Gait Function in Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate the effects of robot gait training with the noninvasive brain stimulation in stroke patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in 10 meter walk test from baseline in gait speed
primary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)
primary_outcome.description: Measure of self selected speeds by measuring the time it takes an individual to walk 10 meters. To perform the test, patient walks 10 meters (33 ft) and the time is measured when the leading foot crosses the start line and the finish line. The instructions are: "Please walk this distance at your normal pace when I say go."

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Berg Balance Scale from baseline in balance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional ambulatory category from baseline in gait function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Timed Up and Go test from baseline in balance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of Timued Up and Go test in balance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: All participants perform overground walking to assess the change of kinematic using a motion analysis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: All participants perform overground walking to assess the change of kinetic using a force plate

secondary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: All participants perform overground walking to assess the change of muscle activation using a surface EMG.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: measure the motor threshold and amplitude of motor evoked potential in first dorsal interosseous muscle and TA muscle.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Brain activation of resting-state functional MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: session 0 (initial visit); session 10 (at approximately 3 weeks); after 1 months from intervention termination (follow-up)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Robot gait training with brain stimulation
arm_group.description: Lokomat robot training and anodal transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) on the leg motor areas

arm_group.arm_group_label: Robot gait training without brain stimulation
arm_group.description: Lokomat robot training and sham tDCS on the leg motor areas

intervention.description: Lokomat robot training was applied to stroke patients.
intervention.arm_group_label: Robot gait training with brain stimulation
Robot gait training without brain stimulation

intervention.description: tDCS brain stimulation on leg motor areas was applied to stroke patients.
intervention.arm_group_label: Robot gait training with brain stimulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: more than 18 years
- More than 6 months post stroke
- Functional ambulation classification (FAC) (1~4)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serious cardiac conditions (hospitalization for myocardial infarction or heart surgery within 3 months, history of congestive heart failure, documented serious and unstable cardiac arrhythmias, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, severe aortic stenosis, angina or dyspnea at rest or during activities of daily living)
- Difficult to understand experimental tasks because of extremely severe cognitive impairment
- History of disorders involving central nervous system
- History of psychiatric disease
- implanted objects that would contraindicate tDCS
